appointment.translation[0].definitions[0: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose
All consultations are by appointment only.
I’d like to make an appointment to see the doctor.
He has an appointment with a client at 10.30.
appointment.translation[0].definitions[1: when someone is chosen for a position or job
Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
They congratulated him on his appointment as chairman.
appointment.translation[0].definitions[2: a job or position, usually involving some responsibility
He has taken up an appointment as Professor of Chemistry.
appointment.translation[0].note_box[0].s: She has an appointment with the dentist at 5 o'clock.
Can you phone the hairdresser and make an appointment?
Have you booked another appointment at the clinic?
He had to cancel all his afternoon appointments.
It’s difficult to get an appointment on Monday morning.
The train was late so I missed my appointment.
Please let us know if you cannot keep your appointment.
My hospital appointment lasted half an hour.
What time is your doctor’s appointment?
I have an appointment at the doctor’s this morning.
I can’t talk now – I have an urgent appointment to get to.
She has a dental appointment, so she won’t be in until later.
Children sometimes miss school because of medical appointments.
Dennis had an early-morning business appointment with a client.
I’d like to make a hair appointment for next week.
I asked for a morning appointment.
appointment.translation[1].definitions[0: an arrangement to meet someone at a particular time and place
Erlich was 25 minutes early for his appointment.
He had an appointment with a union delegate at the Grand Hotel.
Were you able to make an appointment to meet the area manager?
Visits to the doctor’s surgery are strictly by appointment (=you must make an appointment before coming).
appointment.translation[1].definitions[1: when someone is chosen to do a job, or the job itself
I am pleased to accept the appointment and have taken note of the terms laid down in your letter.
a coherent policy for the dismissal and appointment of state employees
appointment.translation[1].definitions[2: a person who is chosen to do a particular job
Our new appointment, Ms Baynes, seems to be working out very well.
